title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: James Schilling to James A. Bates, February 15, 1866
summary: Schilling gives information about an unnamed woman who was once a slave in Staunton, owned by James Trotter. The Bureau correspondence regarding this case revolves around an effort to find employment for her in Staunton, so that she can move there, but Tukey claims that there are no jobs to be found at present.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Employment/Labor, Family, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
